17677427.review:
Jigoku Kisetsukan: Sense of the Seasons is a pixelated bullet hell game similar in type with games Touhou, Len'en and Seihou. Simply put you must survive in maze of rainbow colored bullets, if this sounds too easy just remember that everything that moves tries to kill you and once you hit something it's instakill.

Pros
+Awesome chiptune musics
+Lovable and original characters
+Every character is playable with their own abilities
+Fun and challenging patterns (not too hard)

Cons
-Hitbox is weird, you'll die many times because of this. (Too big/weirdly placed) Makes scratching almost impossible.
-When using focus (shift) the character is really, I mean REALLY slow and when you switch back to normal mode the character goes really fast.-> You'll die to next bullet even you tried to pass it
-Fanbase. Even It's not a thing in-game it's annoying to see people whining that this is a cheap Touhou copy.

17560315.review:
For a game that I just happened to find randomly, I wasn't expecting a lot at first. I'm a huge fan of the Touhou games and thought that this was going to be sub-par compared to them but I couldn't be farther from the truth. In fact this game feels almost identical to playing that series but at the same time it has its own uniqueness about it.

I was also worried that there was going to be a catch seeing as its free to play but the best part about this game is that there isn't. No microtransactions, no pay-to-win aspect of it, nothing. Just a free game on steam with no strings attached.

Last point I wanted to bring up is that, as many already said prior, this game is actually easier than a lot of other games in the genre but that's not a bad thing by any means mind you. Even on normal I still get stressed out trying to dodge everything and I have a lot of fun doing it.

Overall if you love the Touhou series, or you want to try an easier game in this genre for the first time, you can't go wrong with this game.

17538156.review:
[h1]tl:dr Review[/h1]
Nice gameplay, free, good for entering the world of Bullet Hells.
Familiar gameplay, unusual but good music.
9.5/10"Includes Three Sizes"

[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zSKujbOSmX8]Video Game Showcase: Jigoku Kisetsukan: Sense of the Seasons[/url]

[h1]Full Review[/h1]
Good game, nice, almost nostalgic feel for those who play Touhou. Whether the art, or music, or the patterns of the bullets itself, this game is enjoyable. Not only that, but this game, unlike many of the other bullet hell games on Steam, is free. Let me repeat that. FREE. That's right, you can get this game, whether to enjoy a familiar game as a bullet hell fanatic, or if you're trying out the genre for the first few times, this game will take you through that no problem.

[b]STORY[/b]
Now let me get into more details. While it may appear that I've only played about an hour or so on this game, I can clearly say that I've enjoyed the story. At least, one of them. I've played through Tenshi's route, and from what I can tell, alongside the achievements, each route/character, has their own story, that overlaps slightly with each other. Though it may seem that just playing through a single route taking an hour isn't alot of time, this game has a good amount of replayability, with optional twists. 

[b]GAMEPLAY[/b]
There are interesting achievements to gain, that one would not think of doing on a normal basis for a Bullet Hell genre. Like the 'Pacifist', where you do not shoot/kill at all during any route. To not shoot? In a game like this? This is basically a challenge run! It's interesting. However, there isn't much one could do in regards to changing too muhc in terms of gameplay mechanics with the bullet hell genre. Bomb to save yourself, collect drops, move to the top to collect all drops, etc, etc

[b]Graphics[/b]
Now, for the art and characters. The sprites are, well, extremely nostalgic, but that's to be expected. The characters are varied, in both personality and appearance, and even species. The art representing the characters also seem to fit well with the characters, unlike some games where you have the appearance of the character clash hard against their profile/persona. Oh, an added bonus: The girls' three sizes are noted *winks*

Another thing regarding art, or at least, a 'form' of art. The bullet patterns. For those who played Touhou, though we can't exactly tell you which pattern is derived from wher, what we can say, is that a good amount of those patterns are very familiar with us. Something of a nostalgic poke for old-timers(and not-so-old-timers)! For those unfamiliar with the series, don't worry, you won't miss anything but the experience we have~! Although, this part really, really should be in the gameplay section. But oh well.

[b]Audio[/b]
The music, was unusual. It seemed a tad bit odd to me, using chip music for a bullet shooter. However, you end up becoming quite attached to it, and at one point I was killed since I was tapping the left and right in tune to the beat!

[b]DLCs[/b]
Not Applicable

[b]Conclusion[/b]
Read my [tl:dr Review] at the top.

Ho sempre reputato i BulletHell un genere non aperto a tutti i videogiocatori. Con Jigoku Kisetsukan mi sono dovuto ricredere poichè le varie difficoltà di gioco sono molto bilanciate. Per chi gioca per la prima voltaun bullethell non si troverà troppo in difficoltà e per chi invece cerca una sfida che lo metta alla prova avrà pane per i suoi denti. I vari personaggi sbloccabili sono ben realizzati e accattivanti, ognuno di loro sarà differente in velocità, modalità di fuoco, uso delle bombe ecc. I boss che incontreremo nel gioco sono uno degli aspetti più interessanti del gioco poichè saranno sempre gli stessi (eccetto il boss finale che sarà differente per ogni personaggio) ma che in base a chi staremo usando in quel momento, cambieranno d'ordine. I boss finali sono letteralmente PERFETTI. Difficoltà da volta stomaco, musiche spettacolari, e design geniale. Ma sicuramente il pezzo forte che a sua volta è anche unico motivo valido per provare questo gioco, sono le musiche. Non ho MAI trovato un gioco con musiche così belle e azzeccate per il livello o il boss che stiamo affrontando. Unica critica che ho da fare e che alcune meccaniche del gioco non sono molto chiare e dovrete capirle da soli o tramite una guida. Ah già, dimenticavo. Il gioco è gratis e pure Italiano. A questo punto la domanda sorge spontanea..

COSA STAI ASPETTANDO? Scaricalo!

Я наткнулся на эту игру, когда смотрел профиль друга, и меня привлекли в нем милые иконки достижений. Мне они понравились, и, естественно, я решил что я хотел бы себе в профиль такие же. Узнал знакомый по игре Touhou геймплей, обрадовался что она бесплатная, и начал играть.
О геймплее - все то же самое, зажимаешь z чтоб стрелять, x активирует спелл карту, которая расчищает поле, и убивает юнитов\наносит урон боссу, ну и shift чтоб концентрировать выстрелы в одной точке, и, самое важное, замедляться чтоб было легче уклоняться.
Насчет сюжета много сказать не могу, он довольно забавный, очень милые персонажи, читая диалоги много раз умилялся, нельзя сказать что это все плещет разнообразием, но огромный плюс что даже людям с плохим познанием английского большинство того что написано будет понятно, и веьма миленько. Персонажей шесть (кто шестая незнаю, она открывается последней, и ее я еще не открыл), и у них диалоги пересекаются, особенно интересно читать что говорит Нибиро (инопланетянка), там все довольно интересно, и миленько сделано, а в диалогах не от ее лица она молчит.
Звучит замечательно, но вот играть в этом - очень трудно, даже легкую сложность я бы сравнил со сложной в touhou, поэтому если вы играет в данмаку игры впервые - то берите легкую сложность, я далеко не профессионал в этом, поэтому на нормальной смог пройти только первые три уровня. Что на уровне сложности Hell мне даже страшно подумать.
В целом, игра очень сложная, особенно если хочешь получить все достижения, но хотя бы один раз пройти на изи сложности каждого персонажа я бы посоветовал ради диалогов, и милых иконок.

17225654.review:
A fun little vertical shooter/danmaku, which tries a bit too hard to be Touhou. I've experienced some framerate issues a few times, but a quick restart of the game solves it. Anyway, on to the review!

The pixel art graphics are nice and colorful, the patterns look nice and the character sprites, while nothing extraordinary, are nice as well. The menu is quite bland and generic and could've done better with some better fonts and a menu system that looks, well, like anything more than some text on an animated background.

On the audio front, the chiptune music fits the game very well. I especially loved the tracks on levels 3 and 5 along with a lot of boss/character themes. Ingame audio effects are simple, unobrtusive and don't get in the way much. Could be better, but could be worse.

The story... Eh, let's just skip this one, as there is something resembling a story in there, but let's not kid ourselves, these kinds of games are rarely played for the story. 

Finally, the characters. Nothing all that special here either, to be honest. The characters are generally flat-ish and are in there to fill the minimal role of level intro, pre-bossfight and level outro dialog participants. The dialogs are quirky at best and cringeworthy at worst. I'm looking at you, end bosses and "Dev." On the matter of Dev, that character is a brilliant trainwreck. Brilliant, as his mode of attacking is rather fresh, and a trainwreck because of his dialogue and because how annoying it is in practice to play as him. The secret character is nice and for the hardcore players, a nice challenge, I think. Would've loved more, if we got the first one of the bosses instead.

Overall, this game is rough at some points, but then again, some like it rough. It is also FREE, by the way, and that is a fact I had to remind myself while writing this review. This game would certainly deserve a solid $10 price tag or similar. If you're a fan of the genre, you're gonna enjoy it a bunch, and if you haven't played a danmaku game before, give it a go, you won't regret it.

17183330.review:
If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:
1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie 

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

This is a neat little game

In the end you're better off playing Touhou. Not to say this game is bad though, it certainly isn't and is worth playing.

7.5/10

16860005.review:
Shoot'em up(пристрели их всех) маниакальной сложности, поджанра Bullet hell(ад из пуль). Таковым адом игра действительно является и даже на самой простой сложности придется постараться, чтобы пройти хотя бы пару уровней из пяти(судя по достижениям). Именно таковой цели я добился в основном смотря ВНИЗ экрана, а не на самих боссов или противников. Потому что дивчинка умирает от пульки(но жизнь далеко не одна), а мне нужно между ними аккуратно, но шустро лавировать.
Относительно клавиатуры: не хватило плавности передвижения персонажа, он двигается небольшими рывками. Это станет заметно как только начнут поджимать со всех сторон(начнут как только, так сразу со старта, ага-ага). Геймпад поддерживается и возможно решает эту проблему недостаточной маневренности.
Считаю, что именно вот такие игры являются беспрецедентным хардкором высшего сорта, типа общепризнанной Touhou Project и пройти их смогут только сверхлюди(сразу вспомнились Икс-Мэны). Потому игра эта: элитное развлечение для особенно-одаренных реакцией людей(а возможно тут и память нужна, и матан, чтобы просчитывать далеко наперед как же пробраться меж вражеских выстрелов). И стальные нервы тут тоже нужны, поэтому я воздержусь повторно играть, предпочтя их сберечь.
Не понравились ачивменты: банальное "пройди такой-то уровень", "пройди таким-то персонажем", "пройди на такой-то сложности", но щито поделать с этим? Особо негде развернуться. Правда не хватает для полного комплекта "набери столько-то очков". Зато имеется "пройти не умирая" и "пройти никого не убивая"(ШТОООААА?).
Сделана добротно, персонажей несколько, экранчик традиционно маленький и отличный саундтрек. Из-за сложности игра больше всего угодит "ценителям-thedrot'ам"(просьба не обижаться), на коих в общем-то и ориентирована.

16809137.review:
Bullets! Bullets everywhere!

Even on the first level on the easiest difficulty. This is what I call bullet hell.

I definitely suggest playing passively for a while, to get used to movement. Combat is as natural is in any other shmup, but good movement is both difficult and necessary when standard movement feels a smidgen too fast and focused movement feels a smidgen too slow.

An enjoyable game, for sure, but limited playability for someone who's not that great at shmups.

[h1]◆ 『東方』[/h1]
腋は出てないけど肩が出ている巫女っぽい娘が
異変を解決しに行く話（直球）｡かすり点や喰らいボム､
ボス戦前後のゆるい掛け合いにスペカ的カットイン演出など
どう言い繕っても東方Projectの弾幕STGそのもの｡
なんかもう作者自身も開き直っている｡
中華圏発のいつものパチもんかと思いきや英国発の模様｡

[h1]◆ クローンゲームとしてはかなりの完成度[/h1]
内容としては東方としか言い様のないモノだが
道中の雑魚敵がやけに硬かったりして､
感触としては東方紅魔郷を彷彿とさせる難易度｡
この手の弾幕シューティングに馴染みのない人にとっては
難易度イージーでも決して楽々クリアとは行かないように思うが
所詮は覚えゲーなのでいつかは打開できる｡
弾幕の再現度は完璧すぎて逆にオリジナリティーには欠ける｡
「これ誰々のスペカそのまんまじゃんか！」と
ツッコミを入れながらやるのが楽しいが､
もちろんリスペクト元を全く知らなくても問題ない｡
熟練シューター向けの激マゾ実績も用意されている｡

[h1]◆ パクリなのが惜しい[/h1]
登場キャラはみんなかわいい｡普通に薄い本が作れるレベル｡
[strike]正直昔のZUN絵よりも萌える｡[/strike]
さすがにBGMのクオリティで比較すると劣ってしまうものの
無料ゲームとしては必要十分な質のピコピコサウンドを擁している｡
もしパクリじゃないオリジナル作品として出ていて
トレカ等がもらえたなら投げ銭もしていたであろう点が悔やまれる｡
それにしても奇抜なタイトルだ｡地獄季節感ってなんだよ（哲学）

16673356.review: This game is free and must have for anyone who enjoys anime style bullet hell games. The gameplay is much like Touhou.  However, the thing that makes it so charming is it's Scott Pilgrim X The Anime Bullet Hell. From the time I hit play I was enhanted, musically delighted, and the challenge even on easy is truly worthy of the phrase bullet hell. The element of gameplay beyond that is each "boss" becomes playable after you've defeated them.  The dialogue has very humorous elements albeit much like any game of this genre plot holes the size of mars.  It's nice to see the overlaps from the various points of view in the banter between characters.  It could stand a little bit more of a backdrop to the plot; however, again for a 100% free game. It's worth every dime I didn't pay for it and then some!  A+ design. Little tweaking you'd have marketable sequels for future Jigoku Kisetsukan games for absolute sure.  I'm amazed. Thank you very much to the developers and steam for giving us this gem of a game!

A temática é bem infantil, com uma pegada de anime japonês, porém você não vai prestar atenção à esses detalhes, pois vai ter um milhão de tiros na tela, a dificulkdade é bem alta até no easy. Mas se decorar os padrês dos chefes consegue passar. Acontece que tem poucos continues e aí começa do zero, o que pode frustar quem não é acostumado com esse tipo de jogo. Eu só achei o jogo muito colorido, mas a dificuldade me agradou. Se você gosta de se desafiar e passar um pouco de raiva esse jogo é pra você, caso contrário, passe longe.

16527454.review:
Eu não sou grande fã desse estilo Touhou de shoot'em up, que entope a tela de tiros super lentos, e que requer que você faça apenas poucos e pequenos movimentos para desviar de tiros.
E não achei o jogo difícil como estão falando por aqui, pelo menos no nível Normal, a dificuldade é bem tranquila. Tem o lance da bomba "salva vidas" que deixa o jogo ainda mais fácil, e ele é bem generoso com as vidas extras.
E eu não gosto dessa estética "retro moderno", e não gostei das músicas das primeiras fases.

Dito isso, o jogo é bem feitinho, divertido de jogar. Os diferentes personagens precisam de diferentes estratégias para conseguir jogar bem, o que aumenta a variedade do jogo. As bullet patterns são bem feitas e o jogo todo, num geral, é muito bem feito.

Considerando que está de graça, você seria um zé mané de não pegar o jogo e pelo menos experimentar. É melhor que vários jogos do gênero que são pagos ai pelo Steam.
-
I am no big fan of those "Touhou" style of shoot'em up, with lots of slow bullets that are dodged with small and few movements.
I really dislike the "Retro Modern" aesthetics, and I disliked some of the musics here (Mostly on the earlier levels, the later levels have better music)
I also didn't find the game hard at all, at least on normal settings, it has a fair, even if kinda easy, level of difficulty. The "life-saving bomb" makes it even easier, and the game is very generous with the extra lives.

But...
The game is very well done, and a lot fun to play. The different characters require different strategies to play and this add a lot of variety to the game. The bullet patterns are well designed and fun to dodge. The game is pretty well done on all aspects.

Considering this is a free game, you'd be a fool to not at least try it out. This is better than lots of  PAID games on this genre here on Steam. Go get it now!

16491585.review:
怎么说呢，这游戏很好玩
每个角色都有各自的剧情，很良心，而且免费←重点
花了两小时 续关通了 水色 天资 不眠 3线(EZ难度)
然而有些地方不能接受。。。
1.先吐槽人物
水色感觉除了僚机(?)火力比较弱没什么可吐槽的,
猪脚的子弹是不是太乱了一点?
不眠属于那种高速从自身发射子弹,低速固定僚机发射子弹的类型,也就是说低速的时候角色自身是没输出的.那么问题来了
不小心固定错位置,而自机被弹幕封锁不敢轻易高速的时候,就完全打不到BOSS.猫耳娘也是同样的问题,伤害高但是需要在版面稍上方才能有输出,被弹幕封锁在下方也是完全打不到.
O方就做的很好,给自机加一个很弱的子弹,虽然没啥卵用但至少有输出看着舒服
钝色虽然名字里有钝 但是不是太钝了啊喂.速度出奇的慢.而且前期输出太低了,后期也是不低速伤害低的没法玩,然而还牺牲了攻击范围...
看到这么萌一个外星妹子用起来这么渣我的内心几乎是崩溃的.
还有最后的人物怎么解锁啊喂!!!条件完全不明啊 难道要先通完全部5线?!人物渣成这样你还和我说通关?!
2.吐槽弹幕
感觉有的弹幕和O方弹幕很像,看我头像的O灵殿里的O理沙都应该知道我玩O方 
这游戏擦弹和miss的判定简直太奇怪...有的时候本来想擦个弹 结果明明没看见打到判定点结果miss了,有的时候等着miss结果子弹擦过判定点红色部分接近白色的地方还没miss...
而且就算是简单难度也是手残杀手,没接触过弹幕游戏的人估计玩不了一会就把这游戏抛弃了.
3.吐槽音乐
两个字 魔性
P.S. 钝色妹子的主题曲好听

似乎没啥可吐槽的了.
就整体而言,非常推荐这款游戏.←仅限于弹幕游戏爱好者
如果你是手残...对不起我觉得你还是玩其他游戏吧OTZ

第一次写这么长的评测,写的不好的地方还请见谅

16364347.review: This game is a LOT like the Touhou Project games. Is that a bad thing? No! In fact, I highly reccommend that people who are just getting into this genre play this game first. It's a bit easier than the Touhou games, but it can be extremely difficult if you decide to (for whatever reason) play on the "hell" difficulty. The visuals and music are amazing, and I even found myself downloading a "mod" someone made for this game that replaces the music in this game with that of the music from a Touhou game. In general, people who are interested in the bullet hell genre, but aren't ready to play  one of the hardest series in this genre should start out with this game.

我先承认一件事，这游戏玩了以后就是满满的东方感，然后我果断的推荐给了……[h1]魔魔丸[/h1]人家录播都放了，我也来做个评测吧。

不错，是很像东方，而且几乎游戏中的大部分系统，以及"符卡"都能在东方原作中找到出处，但总体游戏更加有难度。
分为三种难法，一个是系统的设定上比同类弹幕游戏更有难度，游戏中的power值，只能靠积攒来获得，阵亡时不会获得”power”，
其次就是游戏的弹幕是在是炫，炫的伤眼，
最后是玩家不同机种平衡太差，近身的弹幕威力还是太弱，激光的威力太为强力，

但是值得夸奖的地方是
像素风格和8bit音乐留下了许多印象，虽然谈不上优秀，但是带入感非常好，
机体攻击方式有许多花样，挑战无止境，宽屏边框不是每个弹幕游戏都有，
人物都有详细介绍，而且不同人物也有不同结局。

作为免费游戏，是彻底的良心！

16285984.review:
A freeware bullet hell game that borrows heavily from the Touhou series, Jigoku Kisetsukan is a surpringly delightful little game that perhaps relies a bit too much on its influences. For those unfamiliar with the Touhou games, they are a self published series of vertical shooting games made by one man, ZUN. In them, a group of colorful anime girls do battle with the player, filling the screen with hundreds of projectiles to be dodged and weaved through as you attempt to grasp victory. Against these overwhelming odds, you are given a few advantages; a tiny hitbox that is much smaller than your character sprite, the ability to slow your character and focus fire for pinpoint maneuvering, and liberal lives and bombs to clear the screen and take pressure off.

It is from this blueprint that Jigoku Kisetsukan takes its design from. A cast of anime inspired characters must blast through 5 stages of increasingly difficult bullet patterns and boss fights, culminating in a final battle that pushes the players skills to the limits. It's in these gameplay setups that the game does particularly well, providing what feels like a solid and fun take on the Touhou games. The game features various characters to unlock, and they all have unique shot types which switch up the feel of the game quite a bit -- one character has a powerful close range attack while another relies on a particularly unconventional homing shot. The mechanics also lean towards punishing the player for deaths, with bombs that rely on killing enemies to be replenished instead of being given with a new life, and a shot power down that has to be earned back. It leads to a focus on proper execution in the face of harder patterns, rather than the war of attrition with lots of bombs that harder shooting game bosses can turn into.

While the core gameplay itself is good, the game does falter in its attempt to tell the story. Parts of it are revealed through the game as you play via each of the characters, but it remains confusing and obliquely told, only really making sense with the supplimental material in the game. As you work through the game, the consequences of whats happening remain vague, and the final arc of the game lacks narrative context and feels arbitrary. A person might say "why care about story in a shooting game?", but the developer put quite a bit of time and effort into the one this game has, and it doesn't quite stand on its own legs.

Perhaps the games greatest flaw though, is that it doesn't pull far enough away from the Touhou games to feel like much more than a fangame. One of the things that could have benefitted Jigoku Kisetsukan the most would be a proper scoring system; the game feels painfully basic in that regard, giving a player little to do but dodge and shoot, and the addition of even something as simple as Battle Garegga style medal chaining or Ketsui style point blanking could add a lot of life to the levels, giving more incentives for players to take risks through the game. Without more advanced scoring mechanics, the game feels like it's missing the biggest draw these types of games have. For the rest of the game, it enthusiastically copies the Touhou games in many aspects, and while this is a successful set of ideas to copy from, it makes the game feel like it lacks its own identity. 

Still, despite its flaws, it is a great little game. It's completely free. I would go so far as to say that Jigoku Kisetsukan is better than quite a number of paid shooting games on Steam. Having learned that the developer released it as their first game, I am extremely impressed. It is a very promising indie release, and a western game that actually gets bullet hell right. The unlockables are fun to get, the game gives a fair amount of challenge with its patterns, and is completely worth a look at for both newcomers to the genre and fans of the Touhou games.

16285068.review:
What is "Jigoku Kisetsukan: Sense of the Seasons"?

Sense of the Seasons is a glorious bullet hell provided by an interesting dev. I say "interesting dev" because of the ending to each character. (Play and beat for yourself, because I'm spoiling naught.) It's certainly not something I expected from such a colorful game, and I'm not disappointed in the outcomes in the least. Emad certainly put some thought into it, which is something I can appreciate in and of itself.
Jigoku Kisetsukan: Sense of the Seasons is fun, addicting, and will leave you in a state of "how am I supposed to dodge that?!" if you were new to this genre like I was.
Do I recommend?  Yes. Definitely. It's a fantastic gateway to newbies and what appears to be a very nice love letter to fans of the Touhou series.


To the dev: Twelve hours of gameplay in a week, and considering it has to be truly enthralling (or hooked-on mindlessness, which this game isn't) to some degree for me to play into it to this extent, that alone is a compliment. But if that isn't enough to-- Y'know what, no. Let me put it this way. I [currently] have 79 cents in my Steam wallet. Despite it not being much, I'd happily give every penny in my...hm...my STEAM pocket to you if I knew of such a way for opening a door to a brutal, exciting, and glorious new world of gaming. Because of this, my enjoyment for gaming has been reignited and I've begun playing the Touhou series starting from the sixth installment. I sincerely thank you for putting such hard work into this game and making it free for those of us who are a bit tight on cash.

Do I have any suggestions or requests for the future? Yes, and only one. Keep going. Build on top of what you have created. Extra levels, characters, soundtracks, whatever. All I ask is that you keep the fire going, because this one will have a special spot in my gaming library for many years to come.

16163772.review:
I was gonna make a touhou funny comment thing, but I'm here to give a normal review which i NEVER do. Onwards.

TL:DR
-Good art and difficulties
-Patterns dry, menu and HUD need more graphics
-but its FREE
-TOUHOU

Basically, yes, this is basically like Touhou, so that's automatically good. I really like the art style (mugshots) but I do feel it has a wee part of fanservice, so yeah. I'm indifferent on the sprites, but visuals are good, except for the HUD and menu. They both could get MUCH better if more was added than just text. Same goes with the backgrounds. I also STRONGLY suggest that you add much more bullet types, since Circles and Ovals are usually the only types there are from enemies.

Music, as usual, can't be matched with ZUN's, but the music is OKAY. I mean, I do listen to chiptune here and there, but I don't think it can really fit in with this game.

If you want some good things from me, I like that you put in stuff in Extras instead of just Start. I was also interested in there being 6 characters, even though I didn't unlock any yet. The Danmaku fits correctly for each difficulty, so I applaud you on that, but the patterns are... Dry. There isn't really THAT much variety, if you know what I mean. I feel it's just fancy-styled patterns, but whatever, it's still hard.

So yeah, although the game has its ups and downs, but I still reccommend it for Touhou fans to try out. It's free, anyway, so that is already a great boost to the rating. I'm hoping to see more!

16078697.review:
作为第一次玩弹幕类游戏的新手，花花绿绿的弹幕，完完全全看花了眼。玩了一个多小时，大致明白之前看到的东方系列各种躲弹幕是怎么做到的，就是明白自身的判定点。
       对抗猫娘的时候被她的漂浮弹幕打的稀里哗啦，之后解锁猫娘发现，这可能是所有角色当中最需要操作的了，完全是近战斩杀模式。新手推荐使用天资，我个人感觉追踪弹很好用，只要专心躲弹幕就行了。刚开始玩的时候不明白这谜一样的判定，各种撞，看了一下按键设置，顿时醒悟，shift按键有着非常重要的作用，既可以显示判定点，又可以减慢飞行速度，这对躲弹幕有着非常大的帮助，自从知道这一点以后，躲弹幕就变得非常轻松。
       boss的弹幕算是比较好躲的，不过龙套侧面飞出造成的撞击还是比较恶心的，宁肯挨弹幕也不要撞上敌人。
*★,°*:.☆\(￣▽￣)/$:*.°★*
       GO，这回是10小时的游戏时间了，只玩简单的故事模式和地狱难度的练习模式，看来我还是比较适合简单难度，地狱难度让我领略了什么叫做无缝弹幕，看到boss，第一反应就是 いっぺん、死んで见る? 想拿高分，就是要不断的擦弹收集符卡。地狱难度会有持续的擦弹声。
       天资小女神真的很适合新手啊，但是并不是因为她强，而是她的全面使得遇到的boss都像是削弱版的。猫娘遇到最后的boss弹幕压制非常厉害，一直堵下面等boss放完好几轮弹幕才敢上去打，外星妹遇到的boss有一轮会发速度很快的下降弹幕墙，只留一个到两个缺口。总的说，就是背板，不然以她奇慢的移动速度就是几轮下来就是撞墙结局。鬼女放炮台可以定点持续攻击，虽然伤害低但是持续输出就是王道啊，高机动力躲弹幕也很轻松，然而遇到了boss的弹幕牢笼以后。。。说多了都是泪，牢笼破了以后还要躲一波超恶心的弹幕。
       在boss战时，尽量先保命，躲不过就放炸弹，不要省。死的次数多了后面几条命都没用了，火力低，要多躲好几轮弹幕。打boss尽量在她一轮生命要结束的时候追着打，这样能最大化输出。
       嗯，差不多了。主要是写给和我一样的新手看的。高手背板的话会更加厉害，那个不死成就估计就是背板狂魔的证明。试着背了一关的板，无伤通关，可惜练习没成就。 (～￣▽￣)→))*￣▽￣*)o我不擅长背板说这些也没用呀，玩猫娘背板可以在敌人放弹幕之前将其消灭（原来是这么玩的(⊙ˍ⊙)）。
*★,°*:.☆\(￣▽￣)/$:*.°★*
这回是12小时的评测内容了，主要纠正第二轮10小时的评测内容。通过地狱练习，即使没有打败boss，只要能看到最后一个阶段的弹幕，简单模式通关就会变得非常简单。另外，猫娘除了上去近战之外，其实远距离躲弹幕也是可以的，之前我一直近战死了好多回。12小时也就是我猫娘通关easy的时间了，boss的弹幕放了好几轮之后会发出嘟嘟嘟的声音，之后自爆。。。以后的游戏时长可能会有水分，毕竟BGM听了好几轮之后，觉得有一些魔性了。（看别人评测说BGM一般，那是听的不够久）总之，根本停不下来！顺便一提，地狱季节感的“季节感”是天资的招数，然而目前外星妹纸人气却是最高的，据说最萌的是140的年龄（这数据居然不是身高）（＞﹏＜）

15938552.review:
一款弹幕风格很像东方的游戏，难度也有4种。但是部分设定让其在同等级的难度下远比东方难……
例如——MISS时没有音效
这意味着当自机穿梭在困难或地狱难度下高密度的弹幕中时，你只能依靠只有在自机MISS时才会显示的，那小小的，并且只有半秒时间的白色数字才能判断自己有没有MISS，然后再反应过来并释放决死。
而实际情况是，在大部分场合下我只有在机体变成一堆闪光碎片的时候才反应过来“啊咧？原来我刚刚MISS了？”
再例如——MISS后不会自动补充B（B只能通过杀敌补充）
这意味着当玩家遇到无法匹敌的弹幕时，在B用完但敌机还未被打倒的情况下，玩家会陷入被单方面虐杀的困局，直到失去所有的残机进入续关或重来。
顺带一提，我是活在东方永夜抄时代的人，在习惯了MISS一次后就能补充2个B的设定后再玩这个真是折磨。
然后还是B的问题——为什么B的上限只有2个？
“嗯，一次决死……又一次决死，啊，我死了。”
最后说说游戏本身的难度吧。
就以困难和地狱的标准来说，整体弹速并不快，和东方一样是属于那种慢悠悠飞过来能让玩家发出“啊……真漂亮，好，它飞过来了，我躲～”这种感叹的程度。但是在密度上就非常具有挑战性了（特别是配合MISS不出声的设定）。尤其是在道中，大量不间断的密集弹幕几乎没让我有任何机会冲上去收集掉落品，以至于全程我都基本是在火力和B未满的情况下战斗的。另外在高难度下敌机的血量似乎有所提升，不知道是不是我的错觉。
总而言之，这款游戏让我找回了以前玩东方的感觉。简洁干净的背景，单纯唯美的弹幕，有点点燃的BGM。（话说最近的东方新作光是背景就要晃瞎我的眼了实在是喜欢不上）
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
最后再补充几句：
作为一个东方全正作能在H难度下比较轻松地通关，L普通地努力一下也能混过去的沙包来说，这游戏在后期真是把我虐惨了。
如果把星莲船L的难度系数比作10的话，那么我觉得这游戏的地狱至少就有15。
所以一句话——手残不要玩，这是对于连东方E都通不掉的人的忠告——想要愉快地玩耍的话，至少先把东方N比较熟练地通掉吧。

15934603.review:
Easily one of the best Touhou clones I've played. The silly dialogue, bullet patterns, hitboxes and controls will be instantly familiar to anyone who has played those games. Also like Touhou, the difficulty level is such that anyone can 1cc the game in normal difficulty without too much practice.

The backgrounds are quite dull during the stages, mostly just clouds, so you don't get a sense of place or of being on a journey, but at least they never blend with the bullets, which is the main thing. The music is a collection of generic chiptunes, lacking any ambition or thematic coherence. I found them quite annoying to be honest and the worst part of the game.

There are 7 playable characters, with some weird balance issues, like the character with a focused laser beam being the slowest of them all, or several of the bosses' patterns timing out because your character doesn't do enough damage, but they are all usable -in the normal difficulty at least, which is what I've played so far.

It doesn't reach the quality of the originals but it is a very competent effort overall.

15926227.review:
[h1]Yes, it's very much touhou. Is that a bad thing? No.[/h1]

The game shares many, oh so many, things with touhou it's kinda funny at the beginning, but if you can get past that the game is surprisingly enjoyable. 

Difficulty wise, it's pretty fair, when starting you might feel a cheap death or two coming your way, but thats part of these games anyway, you need to replay them to get a feeling for different patterns.
You cannot hoard auras (bombs), nor do you recover any after deaths, so it makes for some resource management. 
Gaining lives or auras isn't score based, instead it rewards kills and managing to gather the drops, which is imo silly since they have grazing system in the game, which is essentially allowing a bullet to enter your sprite area without it hitting your actual hitbox, effectively giving you no reason to actually do it apart from score attacks if that's your thing.
Boss patterns vary enough to keep each one interesting and the runs entertaining over multiple plays and best of all, everything on the screen is very clean and simple to keep track of even during chaotic looking attacks.
Offers a fairly good challenge for anyone seeking such.

The story is a mess when first starting out, it opens up somewhat after clearing the game with more and more characters... even after that it's still a confusing pile of things to be honest. But it's a shmup so you most likely aren't playing it for the story anyway.

All the characters bring different play styles with them, some are fun, some not so fun. Each one has their own story, which shares acts from others and mainly differs at the finale. They all were fun in their own way, not that memorable, sadly, but varied enough to make me want to play them all. Also the art in this game is kinda cute.
You will need to clear the game once to unlock each normal character to play.

The soundtrack is chiptune(ish) which is interesting and somewhat weird, but it grows on you. Ofcourse you can always mute it, incase it bothers you alot.


TL:DR: Try it. I found it surprisingly entertaining, so you might too. Should please anyone looking for a pretty decent and simple shmup to play, even if just wanting to try the genre.
Fun, varied, colorful and clean patterns and characters, great music and overall a fun challenge. ...Plus it's free.
Ps. It's not a shame to get your feet wet on easy and progressing from there.

This game is a blessing to shmup fans, it does some things unexpectedly well.

Presentation: Simple, colourful, and clean.
Audio: BGM is fantastic and fits the levels well, bossfight music is pumped up.

Since this is just a vague summary of what the game is like, I urge you all to download this game IMMEDIATELY and get your ass kicked.

15892640.review:
Just to be honest, when I first downloaded this game I was expecting a typical garbage, barely playable euroshmup, but what I got was actually one of the better, if not one of the best western-developed 2d scrolling shooters on steam.

The gameplay works fairly well and there is a decent amount of challenge even on normal, and the character designs are all pretty good. Additionally, there are 4 difficulty modes, different playable characters, and your performance is graded at the end of each stage, which adds replay value. That said, this game isn't great, its inspirations are obvious and it's inspirations are to the extent that Jigoku is too afraid to take risks and do its own thing. Danmaku Unlimited also has very similar if not the exact same mechanics as Touhou, but Danmaku Unlimited has its own unique theme and style in regards to presentation, which helps it stand out from the crowd. The same just can't be said for Jigoku, what with the somewhat generic chiptune soundtrack and "indie retro" graphics.

But it's free and it's fun, so who cares right? Might as well just download it for yourself and see if you like it or not.

15890818.review:
Jigoku Kisetsukan: Sense of the Seasons is a bullet hell shmup game inspired by [i]Touhou Project[/i]. In it you take control of one of the girls [spoiler]or one guy[/spoiler] and fight your way through five stages worth of bullets.

The game can be quite obviously described as [i]"Touhou"[/i]: cute girls flying around shooting fairies or other girls in the face with lasers. But it's a bit more than that. The game has a unique, pixel / chiptune art style most reminiscent of the older PC-98 [i]Touhou[/i] games rather than the modern ones. The graphics are very well-made, with each stage having its own theme, and the music, while kind of repetitive, does set the good mood for every moment of the game and is kind of catchy at times. Besides chiptunes, we are going to hear some metal too, which I personally enjoyed.

As far as gameplay goes, it's pretty much [i]Touhou[/i]: you fly around shooting stuff and dodging hundreds upon hundreds of bullets. Most of the core mechanics are the same, with the only major differences being the [i]very[/i] lenient timing on the deathbombs and the fact that your bombs (called "Aura" in this game) do not regenerate if you die. In terms of bullet patterns, some of them I swear were lifted straight from certain spellcards in [i]Touhou[/i], but that might be just me having a few years worth of experience playing those games. The game has more-or-less [i]Touhou[/i] level of difficulty when it comes to different difficulty levels: Easy, Normal, Hard and Lunat-I mean Hell. It's fun blasting stuff to bits and getting between bullets, which is what matters the most in this type of game.

The character arts, while not as rich in details as for example [i]Touhou[/i] ones, are pleasant to the eye and nice to look at. It might resemble dA level of drawing a bit, but that's not a bad thing.

[spoiler]Another interesting thing is that each character as their final boss faces the embodiment of their own personal fear, which usually comes with its own music theme and final attack. Except for the True Final Boss which the sixth character faces, where almost all the other playable characters gather up and go through a sort-of Boss Rush, which is honestly a pretty lazy idea of wrapping up the game.[/spoiler]

Now, onto the negatives. The game has crappy controller support, accepting only XInput controllers and being unable to even detect DirectInput ones. Considering most of the PC controllers use DirectInput, that hurts a lot, especially considering that the trial version of the fifteenth [i]Touhou[/i] game came out literally two days earlier and doesn't have this issue. I personally suggest using JoyToKey to bypass that (and swapping Focus from Shift to a different button, this button's kind of clunky when it comes to JTK).

Overall, the game may not be perfect, but it's worth playing, especially considering it's free. I recommend it to both [i]Touhou[/i] enthusiasts and players new to the genre.

15882522.review:
I played Touhou, so I thought, why not pick this up? Disregarding the fact that it's free, this is how I feel about it:
 
When I rate stuff, I rate it on how distracting it is to me. Now let's see how distracting the game is.

The graphics weren't stunning, but they did what they were supposed to do (if their goal was to do some old school graphics thing, they pulled it off). It felt very simple to me, but at least it wasn't distracting. You know, ugly. At least it wasn't ugly-distracting.

The music was okay. Not Touhou-tier okay, but at least it did not make me mute the game. When I played for the first time, the only time I actually took note of the music was when there were no enemies to take down. So nope, not distracting at all, in a good way.

Difficulty-wise, the game felt a bit easy in Normal mode. The thing I noticed about the game is that most of the time there's a rain of bullets coming your way. Sure that's bullet hell for you, but I actually would like a bit more of those laser stuff coming at me (like the ones with the bosses). Give me more lasers please.

One surprising way that this game was made easy as well are the death-bomb mechanics. I don't know how it is in the other modes (if it is any different), but if you can bomb, there's a timer when you get hit. That few seconds is huge. It makes it too easy to death-bomb.

Another thing to note is that once you die, the aura is kept at your current state. I find this kind of annoying. If you were really bad a certain pattern, have no more bombs left and die (u nid 2 gitgud boi), you probably will die again because you can't bomb.

I think the game is a good start for people looking to get into bullet hells. Easy, lets you learn about death-bombing, limits you with your bombing (2gitgud) and it's free!

[b]tl;dr: game is gud. gitit.[/b]

I'm utter shit at bullet hell games, so while I didn't play long, didn't even beat the 1st lvl, for the small bit that I played, I enjoyed it, if you're good at bullet hell games, and like anime, chip music, and stylized retro graphics, I REALLY recommend this game. 15879764.review:
The music is nice (I love chiptunes, personally) and the graphics are serviceable enough.
It's fun, but the (Normal) difficulty is high if the player is used to Touhou and there is an unSPEAKABLE unstable equilibrium problem later in the game. The game doesn't restock your bombs when you die and you lose a net 0.65 power points every time you do--- dying twice in succession to a boss leads to you being totally unable to kill them in a timely manner as the shottype ramps up so drastically, and the HP values are very obviously balanced towards fighting enemies with 5.00 power. The end result is being forced to take on bosses for the whole extent of their countdown durations hoping not to get hit and lose even more power. In addition, there needs to be an initial hit SFX or more obvious visual so it doesn't feel like you died from out of nowhere at times. Play the game, but be aware that to get very far endgame you might need to play perfectly.

15872968.review:
Jigoku Kisetsukan Sense of the Seasons (地獄季節感)【無料＆日本語対応】
御薦め:★★★★★★★★☆☆　ジャンル：弾幕シューティング

無料で遊べる弾幕シューティングゲーム。日本語も選択可能です。

選べる伽羅は最初１人だけ、
最終敵にシルエットで表示されてている5人を加えて6人の内から選ぶことができる。
ステージをクリアする毎に伽羅が追加されていく。
又、伽羅によって弾の種類と移動(操作性)が変わってくる。
（自分はまだクリア出来ていないため伽羅最後の1人が解除されてません）

選べる難易度は[簡単]→［普通]→［難しい］→［地獄］となっている。
伽羅を解放するなら簡単でプレイすると良いと思われる。
ただ最初に選べる「天資」という伽羅は移動量が多いため、
大きく避ける場合は素早いので助かりますが、
細かく弾を避けたい場合はなかなか難しいと感じました。

敵を撃破した際、色付きの札が宙を舞上がります。
キャッチすることで
緑ライフ(残機?)、赤パワー(攻撃力)、青:オーラ(ボムゲージ?)がそれぞれ上昇します。
オーラが100％貯まっている状態で弾を受けた場合、
5カウント以内でボムを使用すると墜落せずに済みます。

初見で思ったのは、どこかで見た作品の伽羅配置に見える様な？

15871829.review:
Esse jogo é basicamente um script mal feito no touhou danmakufu, as personagens conseguem ser mais rápidas que a Marisa em EoSD (nota ela era o SANIC naquele jogo) que, combinado a má detecção de hitboxes das balas fazem esse jogo ser praticamente impossível de se jogar decentemente. Em uma "spellcard" de padrão espiral na dificuldade normal, eu consigo em um momento fazer um graze perfeito entre as balas (a distancia entre duas balas nesse jogo é gigante se comparado ao que dá pra fazer pra se desviar de balas em qualquer outro bullethell), mas em outro momento, mesmo estando em uma posição perfeita pra passar pelo meio das balas, o graze não funciona e conta como um hit.
Bombas nesse jogo são limitadas demais e ineficazes demais, basicamente se eu gasto a bomba inicial no stage1 eu não vou ver outra até o meio do stage2, já que, os itens que enchem a barrra de "aura" são escassos e demoram demais pra dropar. Morrer nese jogo é pedir por um start over, porque os inimigos são tankers de WoW e perdendo uma vida, tu perdes um nível de poder das balas e os itens de power up que aparecem ao perder uma vida não enchem nem 20% de uma barra de 100 pontos.
Vindo de um player que faz 1cc no lunatic em jogos da série touhou e que teve problemas pra jogar esse jogo na dificuldade NORMAL!!!

15864044.review:
I crack my knuckles. Get in my best seating position. My arms are relaxed, my eyes are open. I am ready to do this. Furiously tapping the movement keys with the combination of shift, z x c I destroy the enemy. They retaliate with brute force, bombarding me with waves after waves of endless glowing balls, arrows, and other shapes that will incinerate me the second it touches. I maneuver around every bullet, my pupils dilate, darting around the fury of bullets. The bullets turn into a wall, a storm of bullets, a tsunami of death. In the split second, I tap left to pass through the chink I managed to find. 

I've made it. I've passed though the hell of minions YES!

...... then the boss fucks me up. 

When I concentrate on shooting, I get shot. When I concentrate on dodging, I can never defeat the boss. I remember that I haven't breaths for the last minute. Oops. Dead.


I try again. and again, and again, and again...again again. 


Slowly starting to wish that I could use my [b]mouse[/b].

It's a typical bullet hell game. It's good. Really hard, especially with the arrow keys control. The game would be easier if it allowed use of a mouse... but then again, the game is designed to test your limits of multitasking, so I won't complain too much. 

You control your character with the arrow keys, using shift for fine movement. This is important to remember, since life or death depends on milliseconds of timing the movement between hundreds of dots on the screen all moving around at different speeds and direction.

Oh my god. My EYES. After concentrating on the bombardments of rainbow dots, I am starting to see dots everywhere.

15862355.review:
Dieses Spiel ist absolut zu empfehlen. Vorallem, wenn ihr Bullet Hell Games mögt. Von der Schwierigkeit her, ist das game gefühlt schon etwas anspruchsvoller, wie die Games der Touhou reihe, was daran liegen mag, dass es nicht schwieriger wird, je weiter man kommt, sondern sich eigentlich konstant auf dem selben Schwirigkeitsgrad befindet.

Das Spiel bietet eine Auswahl an Charakteren, die man spielen kann, sobald man diesen Gegner besiegt hat. Jeder dieser Charaktere hat ein eigenes Shot-Model und ein anderes Bewegeungstempo, was zu einem manigfaltigen Spielerlebnis fürht.

(Gefühlt kann die Musik leider absolut nicht mit Touhou mithalten, da es sich bei diesem Spiel fast ausschlißlich um 16bit Musik handelt.)

Als Fazit ist zu diesem Spiel zu sagen(ES IST GRATIS) : Nette Ideen für Charaktere und Level und ein angenehmes Spielerlebnis, aber man sollte, wei bei allen Bullet Hell Titeln frust resistent sein.(Auch wenn dieses Spiel sehr viel vergibt).

15858057.review:
You don't see many free games on Steam that don't mean Free 2 Play, but Jigoku is one that is probably a better then a majority of them. It's a great introduction to bullet hell games and feels very influenced by Touhou and others of the genre. Controls are reasonable and the games variety of patterns for bullets and characters keep things fresh. There would be a couple of things I'd like to see added like options for sensitivity controls, but the fact of the matter is: this is a free game that's going to entertain you for a good bit, and you can't go wrong with that. 

+:
[list]
[*] Bullet hell patterns add a lot of variety to the game, and is impressive for a free to play title.
[*] Good selection of difficulties to help introduce new players and challenge others.
[*] Like the art style. It's influenced by Touhou, and it's a strong anime influence, but it's in a good way.
[*] Good variety of unlockable characters.
[*] Controls are consistent, and you can count of them not slipping on you.
[*] It's free. No microtransactions, no bullshit like that. It's a lot better then most <5 dollar games that I've seen over the last year. That should tell you enough.
[/list]
-:
[list]
[*] Would like to see some sensitivity options added for controllers. 
[/list]

For some gameplay and commentary: https://youtu.be/M5f9hdPN-pc

15851006.review:
Before we start, I understand this is a free title. I'm judging and recommending it by the amount of time I've put in to the game to essentially complete it to the fullest, not the amount of money (Or lack there of) I've spent. 

Jigoku Kisetsukan is a Bullet Hell curtain fire game that is heavily based on the [url=http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Touhou_Wiki]Touhou project[/url] (I will be making A LOT of comparisons later on between the two) about a girl named Tenshi having a strange feeling and uncovering what's causing it. Could this game become a new predecessor for the Touhou franchise, or a complete dud? Well, here's my opinion:

Gameplay 6/10: You get to play up to seven different characters, each with their own unique shot type or trait along with a unique final boss, which is actually pretty interesting and I don't see that happen often in games. You can also perform a special attack that clears the screen while dealing a little bit of damage to the boss (You can store up to 2 at a time) depending on how much aura you have. My only real issue about the mechanics is that I find it VERY difficult to recover from dying in later stages.
 
But since it feels a lot like your traditional bullet Hell game, for me to say I hate the gameplay for this game is like me saying I hate the gameplay for the bullet Hell genre (I don't). The new mechanics make me feel that the game is trying to be something else, and I can see that but is it really?

Visuals 7/10: I actually really enjoy them and are probably my favorite aspect of the game. They remind me a lot of Cave Story but in a shmup setting. Although some sprites do look a little off, a majority of them are well done. The artwork for the characters do feel a little uninspired but are still much more appealing to look at compared to early Touhou games.

Difficulty 5/10: No, I don't find the game difficult, I 1cc'd my first run, so my score isn't based on the game being too hard (but that's not saying it's too easy). Once you get the hand of not dying in the first two stages, the next three aren't much harder. The difficulty only ramps up significantly on the Final boss (Let's just say I've managed to die not once, not twice, but five times on the Fear of Past and Future boss). My issue is that because the difficulty doesn't increase enough, the game stays static in a sense and there isn't a challenge outside of actually swapping the difficulty from normal to hard mode or achievement gathering. 

Simply put, it's better to have a simplistic Stage 1 and work its way up to a heavily challenging End Stage than a difficult Stage 1 that slightly increases from there.

Sound 6/10: I'm not a fan of chip tune. But I DO like a couple of tracks from this game, most notably the third stage and boss' themes. However, I find most songs I might not really listen to on my own time, being more average than fantastic (Not implying that they're actually bad, just... Y'know, average).

Story 3/10: Out of the respect for the developer, I'll be keeping the spoilers tag for those interested in finding out the whole Story for themselves. If you can't finish the game six (let alone once) times, yet want to still know my opinion, by all means: 

[spoiler]This is by far my biggest gripe about Jigoku Kisetsukan because it's the main reason why I played for a long while, the overall plot with each character (there's six, it takes roughly a little more than twenty minutes to beat the game with one, my playtime's reasonable for that). The first four bosses are your typical Anime clichés. You have the level headed protagonist, always-in-a-temper girl, cute nekogirl, an absurdly shy girl (In her defense, she's from another planet, so I'll let it pass), and the girl who wants to snuggle everything. Because the circumstances and their personalities clash, they fight one another when they meet. 

Your main protagonist senses something is wrong and eventually gets possessed. The others follow suite soon after before they have to fight the embodiment of their greatest fears. This is pretty much when I stopped enjoying the story. The last boss for character six claims to be the ultimate human fear: death itself. While death is fairly common to fear, a lot of people and cultures identify death as the end of something for a new beginning, which is a very good way to view death. If anything, ultimate human fears would be arachnids or heights/flying (A little ironic when the cast flies).[/spoiler]

Call it a nitpick, but when I see a story like in Touhou, I get something that enlightens me a bit whether it be about Japanese folklore or some good fortune cookie logic (Shikieiki Yamaxanadu from Touhou 9 does very good examples of this). With Jigoku Kisetsukan, I feel the story is there for the sake that there's a story while executing this poorly.

Overall, despite it being heavily based on Touhou, I think that's one of Jigoku Kisetsukan's biggest flaws. It's more known to me as a free Touhou-on-Steam rather than something more independent. Ultimately, the game's very standard with some flaws, and that just doesn't make the game too memorable. For that, along with my time feeling wasted by trying to discover the story in its entirety, I can only recommend it to people who can't obtain a schmup in any other way, or to a schmup fan in desperate need of a new game, and that demographic's too low for me to give this a general recommendation.

 Touhou didn't start out good either, it took about 6 installments to gain its popularity. I hope Jigoku Kisetsukan will continue to expand and show its independence away from the Touhou Project while gaining the same attention but in its own special way.

15848883.review:
Let's start with the review. The game is a Danmaku style, most popularized in the west by Touhou, so the two games feel very much alike. They are not the same game, as each has its own differences. Jigoku Kisetsukan is slightly harder then most Tohuou games, resting at about Touhou 11's or 12's level of difficulty. Early on the game consists of a lot of what i call panic spells, attacks that look scary, until you sit back and notice the pattern, then they become rather easy. Later on, about stage 4, the game changes into actually difficult attacks that don't rely on panic spells to kill you. 

My pros for the game are as follows.

[list]
[*] Large cast of playable characters, 5 main and 1 unlockable 
[*] Interesting characters and designs that don't feel overly sexualized for the sake of "because"
[*] Boss Attacks that both look and feel unique
[*] Interesting take on the spare life counter and interesting ways of collecting lives and bombs
[*] Boss attacks are genuinly challenging and require skill to complete
[*] Stage practice mode for all characters and difficulties
[*] Character dialog. say you are playing as Tenshi and reach stage 4 and you fight Fumin, then you play as Fumin and reach stage 4 and fight tenshi, the dialog will be the same. Tenshi will say the same lines if you are playing as her, or as Fumin and same with the other Characters. A little thing, but one that I liked as it made the different characters all feel like they are in the same general time zone. Plus if you are playing as Nibiiro, you can see what she is thinking during her periods of silence from the other character's perspective.
[*] Parts of the OST, stage 3, stage 4, stage 5 and several of the boss fight 5s come to mind when I think of the good songs in the game.
[*] Depending on which character you pick, you will get a different final boss. All the final bosses share 3(I think) attacks, but the rest are unique to that boss
[*] The bars on the side of the screen that house the HUD are slightly transperant so I can see where enemies are coming from, before they start firing so I can prepare to kill them off quickly.
[/list]
I may add to this as I play the game more.

My cons for the game and reasons why are as follows
[List]
[*] The HUD for it is a little... not good. The life, power, and bomb bar are cramed down in the bottom left, rather far away from where you focus on causing something like checking how many bombs you have can mean opening yourself to get killed. Plus the actual number amount of lives and bombs is a bit small, making it harder to see, and thus adding to the first reason.
[*] The stage 5 attacks have a very sudden jump in difficulty, they feel a bit too hard all of the sudden. Though I suppose that will go away with time and practice.
[*] Character's don't handle the best. this is more of a personal con, but everyone except Nibiiro moves around a bit too fast, where as Nibiiro moves a little too slowly. I did end up adapting to Nibiiro's slow speed and massive power and she is my current favorite, but the other cahracters all have the same move speed which is just a bit too fast for me to really play well.
[*] Some of the shot types are rather unfair. Another personal Con, but Eiko, Mizuiro and Fumin all have weird shot types that just feel so akward, especially Eiko with her TD focused Youmu-esque short range blade cuts.
[*] The chiptune OST at times, while there are some good songs in the game, some bad ones that give me a bit of a headache. Plus if you take too long killing the midboss and the stage song runs out, it doens't loop meaning you have no song playing until you reach the boss.
[*] The location of the enemy names bothered me a bit, simmilar to my HUD con, they are kinda out of the way and you don't notice them much so I have been having trouble learning the names of the characters.
[*] You don't get bombs back after death, making it so that if you run out of power due to constant death during a boss fight, you are screwed unless you are willing to use a continue.
[*] During boss fights, loosing power to dying often is hard to come back from. Clearing a boss attack doesn't give enough power to make up for losing 1-3 points of power
[*] The plot is... hoping to be there. The gist of Tenshi's story is understandable somewhat, if not a little bland. however the other character's stories are nearly non-exsistant. Not to mention The last unlockable character, ??? or [spoiler] TenSHI [/spoiler] has no plot, and actually conflicts with something else in the game's story. [spoiler] You play as tenSHI, who is Thanatos, the embodiment of the fear of death who stole the body of Tenshi, yet you fight Tenshi as the final boss. How can you play as TenSHI, yet fight tenshi? [/spoiler]. While it does feel like there is indeed different stories all going on at the same time with how each character fights Tenshi where you would fight them if you were playing Tenshi, it still feels like there is no plot to the game, and the little plot of Tenshi's story isn't well ended.
[*] A continuation of the last one, what about Muzuiro? Her search for the Druid that helped her as a child was an interersting idea that I wish we could see more of. does she ever actually find the druid?
[/list]

Those were the cons, and here are a few things that don't fit in either con, or pro, but that I want to mention, mostly to the dev.
[list]
[*] Midbosses, like the stage 4 one I think. Negadev was it?  I want to know more about it but there is nothing about it, same with the other midbosses like the pilots of Nibiiro's space ship, or Mizurio's dragon thing in her stage and bombs. Plus why did Nibiiro blow her own ship up and then cry about how it is gone now.
[*] I feel like Eiko, at least as tenshi, wasn't explained well enough. I didn't really get that it was a curse giving her the ears until after I beat her, which at that point I was too busy getting into the game to realize it until I played through Tenshi's story again to 1CC it.
[*] Nibiiro's ball things also confused me, what exactly are they? The eye things I mean. Playing as her, they act as her fammilars to fire her lasers, but I don't see them in her boss fight, or her ever think about them. I assume they are her weapons?
[*] I would like it a lot of there were volume controls, like to make the sound effects louder, but not change the volume of the music. Also a Music library like the Touhou games has would be nice.
[*] There is an issue with the achivements, not sure if this was intended, but I can unlock ???/[spoiler]TenSHI [/spoiler] by unlocking Dev, then just going back and playing another character for a second time, instead of beating Dev's story. Plus I could get achievments by playing on easy and using continues. Lastly playing as ???/[spoiler]TenSHI [/spoiler] lets you get the "immortal" achievment by simply playing the character as you should. I think getting that achievment should be locked if playing as ???/[spoiler]TenSHI [/spoiler]

[/list]

Lastly is my overall opinion of the game. Freaking awesome. I wish more fans of Danmaku would make games like this.
[i][b][u]Reminder, 5/10 is average, 5/10 doesn't not mean it is bad, just that it is not good or bad[/u][/b][/i]
Music: 6/10
Attack patterns 8/10
Character: 9/10
Challenge level: 8/10
Story: 3/10
Overall Score: 7/10
I hope to see a sequel of some kind eventually. Whether it follows directly after this game, takes place before, later, or has an entierly new cast, I want to see more of this kind of work.

15845937.review:
I haven't played into this game much yet -- but I've still played enough of it to give it a "recommended" review IMO.  Why?  Because the game is FREE and fun.  That's good enough, right?  Obviously a game being free alone does not warrant its download -- but if it's a fun game that achieves its gameplay goals, *that* does.

Anyway, as has been said before, "Jigoku Kisetsugan" draws HEAVILY from the "Touhou" series.  It's not IDENTICAL, mind you, but the similarities definitely shine through.  It IS close enough that, were it not free, (and, were it not standard procedure to mimic / rip-off / pay homage to Touhou) it could approach reprehensible.  But... that is not the alternate reality we live in.  As it stands, this is a very fun little shooter by a new(-ish?) developer, with a LOT of promise for the future.

My only major gripe with the game, so far, is the fact that you seem to get 1 starting "bomb" per CREDIT, not per life -- at least on Normal difficulty.  IMO this is absurd, not because the game is especially difficult, but because it's standard procedure in the genre and combat feels a bit bland without it.  Then again, I am still "learning" the game.

Anyway, it's fun, it's free, and it's *almost* Steam Touhou.  Check it out!

一个少女打飞机的免费游戏，各种东方project的既视感。每打过一关boss就能用那个boss作为自机，对应的剧情有也变化，用前5个打完可以解锁第6个自机，用其打出true end可以解锁自虐用第7号自机。不同机体间性能差异很大，在boss战时差别更加明显。

难度设计上还不够成熟，在前后关卡难度的循序渐进上弄得不够好，难度起点较高，但关卡间的上升幅度不大。与东方系列的平均弹幕难度相比，前两关较难，中间两关中等，最后一关中等偏易。虽然本作决死时间较长且有提示，但由于机体只允许携带最多两个炸弹，且掉命后不会自动补充，整体难度还是比东方系列平均水准要高些。

整体弹幕设计中规中矩，有自己的特色，但让人眼前一亮的创新点也不多。

如果玩普通或更高难度，建议把 %LOCALAPPDATA%\Jigoku_Kisetsukan\config.ini 中的vsync设置成0来关闭垂直同步，否则会卡。目前1.06版中还不能在游戏界面中设置此选项

15840195.review:
It's a decent Touhou-type bullet hell game. If you have some experience in the genre, go ahead and give it a try. It's free, eats almost no space on your HDD and an old 10+ years old toaster, like mine can run it. 

However, if you are totally new to the genre, I'd recommend Crimson Clover instead. Reason: Jigoku Kisetsukan is HARD. Just look at the trailer video. Those aren't extraordinary fights, no, that's pretty much the difficulty level across the board. Your screen is going to be filled with projectiles pretty much all the time, not just during bossfights. Add to the fact, that you have 3 lives, and two continues (if you've used up all of your lives) and that's it. If you run out, you have to reset the entire progress, not just the level. So if you run out of continues on the last level, you have start the entire game all over again. So if you're new to this, chances are that you won't even make it to the end of the second level on your first try. On easy. On hard, you probably won't live long enough to even see the first boss. So only try this if you have some experience with the genre, or you have the patience of a saint.

15839917.review:
Мне противно само существование этой игры, однако я довольно долго думал какую оценку ей поставить.
Начну с хорошего: она бесплатная и она очень сильно похожа на Touhou Project.
Теперь всё остальное/плохое: игра не просто похожа на Touhou Project, это и есть Touhou Project. Многие Spell card (я их называю как в Touhou) боссов не просто похожи, а дублируют один в один Spell card из Touhou. Более опасные Spell card постоянно мелькают в начале боя или в середине, а более слабые всё время в самом конце. Атаки от которых невозможно/очень сложно увернуться. Часть персонажей управляется как персонажи из Touhou, а персонажи с относительно оригинальным управление почти неиграбельны (ими просто невозможно управлять). Нельзя выключить музыку или настроить громкость музыки и эффектов. Hit detection просто невозможно предсказать, иногда он позволяет снаряду пролететь мимо почти вплотную, а иногда оказывется очень чувствительным. Сражения между персонажами происходят по более глупым причинам, чем в первых Touhou. Присутствие Хатсуне Мику как босса.
Может я слишком строг к игре, я получил небольшое удовольствие от игры... Но потом, когда я выключил музыку из Touhou и вспомнил, что это абсолютно не связанный с ним проект меня начали одолевать сомнения.
Игра не плохая, но она полность копирует Touhou, потому я голосую против.

This is a touhou clone. If you like touhou, you will like this game. Compared to touhou, this game has:

[+] Better artwork (this guy draws anime girls better than ZUN)
[+] Higher replay value (each character has 1 unique boss fight)
[+] More interesting bullet patterns (patterns which ZUN seems to reserve for extra bosses show up throughout this game)
[-] Less memorable music (chip tune is good, but the touhou community has done so much with the touhou music)

You can't go wrong with a free game and the developer seems like a cool guy. When asked why the game is free, he said because he already has a job and he'd rather see people play the game than make a quick buck. I hope he makes a sequel and I'd gladly pay him for future games.

P.S. Read the character book, he did a good job with it.

15831318.review:
This game brings without a doubt the essence of the old bullet hell genre.

Do not let the cute protagonists and pretty colours fool you tho, for this game is relentless!
With 4 levels of difficulty you can go easy or normal to get ye ol' reflexes back in action, and/or go straight into the chaotic abyss that will soon be your colourful jellybean dodging, wrath indulging, existence at Hard or Hell difficulty, for that is where this jewel really shines.
"But my friends call me "Hawk eye quick scope McGee" in Cod, so It should be easy."
.......Oh boy you are in for a treat. 
Undoubtedly the game is very unforgiving, and you will release a few screams in anger and a few keys from your keyboard will visit new and exotic places of your room via Angry-Fists airlines, but...after a few reassembly's you'll start to notice your sight getting sharper, less distracted on the shiny colours, and most important you'll improve that hand eye coordination that made anyone who threw you a ball burst into laughter at your bleeding nose.
Graphics are kept retro, as what Japanese games concern.
Story and dialogue are scarce at best but I think no one ever came for the bullets and stayed for the story, although the few dialogues will surely get a smile out of you.
You have a roster of characters to choose from (after unlocking them by beating them in-game)
Music is very nice and according to the gameplay, keeping you at the edge of your seat and sanity all the time.
Controls are as simple as one, two, three...no, really there are two buttons and movement.
And last but not least, it's FREE!
No hidden scams, just plain free!
I left that point for last for I don't like forgivingness on a game because it's free.
A game is a piece of art, and as such it must transmit the feeling of perfection on it's own terms.
This provides that feeling.


TL/DR version:
-The game proves very well done, you feel the same energy from the old classics.
-For beginners in the genre this is a great way to get into the action, and veterans will find a great challenge.
-Variety of characters with different attack styles to fit everyone like a glove.
-Variety of difficulties from peaceful to "mouse to the wall!"
-Unforgiving.
-High replayability.
-Joystick compatible.
-FREE!

Final Score:

9/10 would destroy Joystick again.

15829997.review:
Всем любитялям Тохошки рекомендуется.
Игра определенно затягивает с момента входа. Музыкальное сопровождение просто невероятное, стоит играть даже ради треков. Сама игра на уровне Тохо, имеется большое количество играбельных персонажей с разными видами атак. Имеется четыре сложности, а именно: легкая, нормальная, сложная, адская. Есть дополнительный контент, такой как данные о персонажах. Присутствуют нереально сложные достижения, но это оправдано жанром. Также имеется поддержка контроллера, что очень радует. Прочитав несколько диалогов, сразу хочется узнать, что будет дальше. Спрайты в аниме-стиле очень сильно радуют глаз. Снаряды создают нереально красивые узоры и картины. Сам ждал игру уже с гринлайта, хотелось побыстрее купить. А тут такое, - она еще и бесплатная. Я думаю, что разработчики зря принебрегли ставить цену, ведь игра бы непременно окупилась. 
Из минусов, только один - ситуация, когда снаряды моментально убивают игрока, который до этого был на месте образования этих снарядов.  Больше минусов я не встретил. "Jigoku Kisetsukan: Sense of the Seasons" - идеальный представитель жанра данмаку, достойный того, чтобы играя, на него потратили дни, а то и недели.

15828944.review:
So many reviews of people that have played many similar games. Note I have not. That last remotely even similar I played was in the Gradius Series... Been a long time since then, as I had interest in other games.

Picking this one up, due to it being free; with limited funds these days I have to choose carefully on each next game.

Thank you for a lovely game.

Didn't really pay attention to this genre due to hardly knowing it existed, but I can say I love it. Reminds me of lots of games that pushed me to go further.

This is an arcade style game that was named rightly so "bullet hell", although I usually just call them shooters, as it is the same premises. Just with a few different mechanics in mind. 

The main one being the "bullets" on the screen, and the paterns to each spread with each enemy you run across in the game. Seems like the genre advanced even further since I last played it, and happy that it did. They have come a long way.

Sure there are plenty of other games out there, possibly even better ones by some of the more dedicated followers of the genre. However for someone like myself it is just another simple game to focus on in short bursts that can last anywhere from 15 minutes to an hour.

Granted I have not, as of this review, gotten very far in the game; at least i see my own progress as I get sometimes further with each try. This is on easy. If you don't have experience in this genre, and don't have much eye hand coordination with a limited amount of memory; then don't let the name fool you, as it may not be as easy the name implies.

That will vary from person to person and what games they are use to. All I can say is Patience, Practice, and Determination can keep you addicted to this game for a bit if you find it is difficult. Those that don't and find it easy on even the higher difficulties, then you are not missing much.

Now I enjoy the art style, as it is colorful, and easy to keep track of for myself. It may not be for everyone, but since it is free you might as well have a try at it.

I would at least recommend trying this game even if it had a small price tag, which it doesn't. For me I found it worth my time. Enjoyable with each attempt.:)

终于有免费STG类的游戏可以让我写测评辣！
      本人大概算是一个东方厨，然而只是个沙包不是触手，目前全整数作N难度通关，风神录EX难度通关，自认为底力能过妖妖梦H，然而总是作大死。目前大概有两个月没怎么玩了，手稍微有些生[spoiler]【我才不会说是被拉入了舰女人的坑】[/spoiler]
      难度方面，比东方大不少，easy大致对应东方的normal难度，【大概和地灵殿N、红魔乡N差不多】。刚打的EASY第一局到四面没有掉残，然而这个游戏学习了东方四面掉残的优良传统，过了四面还有三残多一点。五面【最终面】的boss在EASY难度下也略鬼畜，尤其是某些【符卡】真的是初见杀，熟悉特定的走位后可能会比较好攻略。[spoiler]作为沙包的我续了两条命才打通，究竟为何请看下文[/spoiler]
      画面风格也是比较像东方系列，人物立绘很萌【一定程度上完爆zun绘】，光影做的比较好，弹幕也很漂亮。但同时有些不足之处需要说明：弹幕和道具以及自机子弹有一定概率混淆【第一次掉残就是因为看花了】。另外自机处于板底的时候判定点看的不是很清楚【板底党杀手】。
音乐是纯粹的洗脑电子风格，还算可以，但是感觉做的更细致一些会更好。
游戏系统而言，可以理解为没有多余的系统，纯粹的复古STG【就像风神录那样，也许是我没玩到？】
       唯一令我不爽的，也是最终面boss续两条命才打过的原因，就是——复活后竟然不！给！雷！直接结果就是很容易造成一张符卡灭你所有残机。
      总而言之，作为一款免费游戏而言，游戏质量较好，游戏体验也还是很不错的。
_____________________________________________________________________________-
今天又打了几局easy难度，熟悉了操作并且适当背板之后感觉没有一开始感觉的那么困难，之前给出的EASY相当于东方地灵殿、红魔乡N难度是高估了这款游戏的难度，现在看来大概是永夜抄N难度的级别。
游戏中自机一共有7个，区别都很明显，相对的不同自机的难度差别也略有些大。【猫娘自机的难度要明显高于其他角色的难度，属于趋向于强制背板的机体】
三面的震屏、四面的闪光都比较影响操作，这应该是作者有意为之的增大难度的地点。
游戏自带丧心病狂的成就系统，非大触基本不用考虑攻略全成就【然而什么都难不倒大触】

15825391.review:
Here's a review from a Touhou fan who really appreciates a good bullet hell shooter.

And this is a good bullet hell shooter.

Graphics - The character portraits are cute and lively, while the gameplay graphics have a more retro pixellated feel. It all feels very charming and indie. The bullet shapes and colors are almost exactly like Touhou's, which makes for some very pretty patterns.

Sound - Chiptune soundtrack with some names that might be familiar if you're into the chiptune scene (I personally recognize Zabutom). The tracks are energetic and distinctive, though it sometimes feels like something is missing. Also, the sound effects are well done, with clear cues for everything necessary in a bullet hell shooter. There are no harsh sounds, like Touhou's infamous chimes and bells.

Gameplay - Stages are well-paced, though the enemies may come through a bit faster than you're used to. The bosses present a variety of challenges to overcome, and there are even some attacks inspired by Touhou spell cards. The normal difficulty feels easy enough for those curious about the bullet hell genre, while Hard and Hell modes are sure to provide a great challenge for veterans. Plus, there's six different playable characters with their own shot type, dialogue, and unique final boss.

Overall, there's a whole lot to be enjoyed in this FREE game, and it definitely ranks well among the other bullet hells on Steam, such as Danmaku Unlimited and ExCeed. There's no catch, no microtransactions. If you're even a little curious about bullet hell shmups, DOWNLOAD THIS RIGHT NOW.

15822518.review:
I'm someone of an amateur when it comes to bullet hell games: I can't 1CC Lunatic any Touhou games. Game plays very similar to Touhou games in terms of visuals, gameplay, and mechanics. Based on my experience with Normal mode, the game doesn't seem to be extremely difficult, but it still presents a decent challenge to those who are experienced with bullet hells to a limited degree.

The gameplay of most bullet hells is very similar, so I'll just point out some finer details. You have 2 bombs in this game that recharge by killing enemies/clearing boss phases. Ultimately, these bombs don't recharge very quickly, maybe at a rate of 1-2 per level? When you have both bombs charged, you get like a 5 second window to last bomb. These bombs do not recover when you die.
I feel like normal enemies take a relatively long time to kill in this game while bosses are generally pretty weak, only getting off one pattern cycle of shots per phase.
Hitbox leniency, bullet effects, boss patterns, enemy patterns, story, art, and musical emphasis are all very similar to Touhou, making this a great way to get started on the bullet hell genre or a fun diversion for some more experienced players. Another interesting thing is that the game makes great use of the left and right sides of the screen by showing enemies that are approaching from outside of the tiny playing field.

One minor gripe I had was that I don't feel like I have that much control with the keyboard, and yet the game doesn't recognize any of the controllers I have connected to my computer.

TL;DR:
PRETTY MUCH A TOUHOU GAME. HAVEN'T TRIED HARDEST DIFFICULTY YET, SO I DON'T KNOW HOW HARD THIS GAME GETS. FOR THOSE FAMILIAR WITH THE SMASH BROS SCENE, THIS IS THE PROJECT M TO TOUHOU'S MELEE.

สรุปสั้น Jigoku Kisetsukan: Sense of the Seasons
- มันคือ Touhou จบนะ----- เดี๋ยวๆๆๆๆ
- เอาใหม่ๆ ตัวเกมก็เป็นแนว bullet hell shooter game
- แปลตรงตัวก็เกมยิงที่เป็นมุมมองจากด้านบน ใครเคยเล่นเกมอย่าง Sonic Wings , Raiden Legacy หรือ Giga Wings มา ก็น่าจะเก็ต ตัวเกมประมาณนั้นแหละ
- แต่จุดเด่นของเกมนี้ คือ การฝ่าห่ากระสุนจำนวนมหาศาล แบบที่เห็นแล้วต้องร่ำร้องว่า พ่องงงงงงงงงงงงงงงง
- การบังคับของตัวเกมก็เหมือนเกมแนวยิงทั่วไป มียิง มีปล่อยบอมบ์ แต่จะพิเศษกว่าเกมอื่นนิดหน่อยตรงมีปุ่ม Slow (กด Shift) เพื่อทำให้ตัวละครเราสามารถเคลื่อนไหวได้ช้าลง
- นัยว่ามีไว้สำหรับเกร็งขมวดกรวยไตเพื่อเล็ดลอดช่องว่างของห่ากระสุนได้สะดวกโยธินขึ้น
- แต่ถึงกระนั้นแม่งก็ยากอยู่ดี
- ตัวเกมเริ่มต้นมาจะสามารถใช้ตัวละครได้ตัวเดียว คือ Tenshi
- แต่หลังจากปราบบอสได้ ก็จะได้บอสตัวนั้นมาเอาไว้ใช้เล่นในครั้งถัดไปได้ด้วย ซึ่งตัวละครแต่ละตัวก็มีรูปแบบกระสุนและบอมบ์ต่างๆกันไป
- ตัวเกมมีแยกระดับให้ด้วย Easy Normal Hard และ Hell
- Normal กูก็จะตายห่านแล้ว ตะกี้ลอง Hell ไป กูยอม บัย (กระสุนจากลูกกระจ๊อกระดับ Hell นี่ประมาณระดับบอสใน Normal เบย )
- ที่สำคัญ ตัวเกมเป็นเกม Free to Play แถมมี Achievement

สรุปรวมๆ ใครเป็นแฟน Touhou มาก่อนก็น่าจะชอบเกมนี้ ใครสนใจอยากลองเกมแนวยิงฝ่าห่ากระสุนปริมาณมหาศาลบ้านไหม้ ที่ต้องเขม็งขมวดกรวยไตหลบหลีก เพื่อสัมผัสประสบการณ์ใหม่ๆ ที่แฟนๆโทโฮเขาชอบกัน ก็จัดกันไป (แต่ Achievement แม่งโคตรโหด ให้จบเกมระดับ Hell กับจบโดยไม่ฆ่าใครเลยนี่ จะบ้าเหรอวะะะะะะะ)

·机体的立绘不会动（你移动的时候图片是僵硬固定的、这样手感很差）

·你子弹级升的太慢了！

·你飞的太慢了！

15820693.review:
As a Touhou gamer, this game literally has the same layout as other Touhou shmups. So Touhou players will find this pretty nostalgic.

I recommend trying this out if you want to know what Touhou is like without actually trying/buying Touhou. These types of Japanese indie games are designed with controllers in mind, so hopefully you have one, but it is still possible to play it with a keyboard, you use won't have as much control over your character.

If you're just starting out with these types of shumps (aka danmaku,) start on Easy, because it's like a Roguelike/lite, it's going to be hell.

What I really like about all danmaku games is their portrayal of bullet "art" and great music. Music in this game is no exception.
