15815235.review:
On the one hand, I have to reccomend this game. It's free, a decent bullet hell SHMUP, and kinda fun. The music is fine, the pixel-art aesthetic is cute, individual character designs seems interesting by themselves (especially the final bosses), and the lives system specifically is something I find fairly interesting from a developer standpoint. Also, the scoring system is decent, which helps.

BUT BOY IS THIS A FLAWED GAME. The biggest problem here is the bombs/aura system. On the one hand, dying in this game is fairly forgiving; in general, the patterns are easier than a lot of other games, and it gives you a short period of time to bomb once getting hit, like in Touhou, so you don't lose a life. The problem is that once you die, your aura doesn't reset, meaning that once you start dying and have no bombs left, chances are you will keep dying until you have to use a continue. Combined with the fact that your power level will decrease every time one dies, and I found myself having to slog for almost a minute through a single pattern until the timer FINALLY ran out. At that point, that just overly punishes dying, and leaves barely any room for player mistakes. The player is basically required to learn how to play perfectly.

That being said, one can practice every single stage on any difficulty using the "Training" mode, without having to unlock them first, so players can actually learn how to play perfectly.

BUT, that just leads into the other problems I have with this game. While the dev seems to understand how to make good, challenging, patterns, they are SUPER generic, especially if you've played other bullet hell games. I found myself saying "Oh, this is Cirno, just modified a little" or "Huh, that looks an awful lot like Mokou". They feel slapped together and inconsistent, without any definable traits that can be given to the characters or their patterns. Speaking of characters, the game barely has any definable ones. The characters just seem thrown together from a grab-bag of different stories, and they have barely any defining characteristics, including their bullet patterns or their music. I admire that the game seems to try something a little different, adding a surrealist bent to it's story (SPOILERS: The overarching theme of facing/dodging one's greatest fear), but I don't beleive that that was intentional. There's just too much inconsistency in the aesthetics and the story for that to be true.

In short, as a "Touhou-lite" game that you can play just for fun, this comes with a tentative reccomendation, especially as it is a free game. Just be aware that the flaws are rather first-gamey, and that it's not as engaging or coheisive as a main-line Touhou or any other bullet hell.

15814569.review:
不得不说这是一款很有意思的弹幕小游戏，像素风格的文字，8bit的音乐，不错的立绘还有剧情都是值得推荐的。不过从另一方面来说，游戏里明显带有东方系列的色彩，不少的弹幕都有红魔乡的风格。但是总体上来讲是一部不错的游戏，如果是东方众或者弹幕游戏爱好者的的话更是推荐一玩！啊，最后补充一点，这款游戏的难度稍微有点难，难度选择的时候请把难度提升一个等级来看哦wwww
————————————————————————————————
PS：提供一些自机信息供大家参考。
天资（TENSHI）：前方集中攻击+追踪弹，类似灵梦，火力提升加强追踪弹数量。
夏鸟水色（MIZUIRO NATSUDORI）：前方集中型，慢速模式火力更集中，类似魔理沙，火力提升加强向前弹幕数量。
雪见荣枯（EIKO YUKIMI）：前方斩击型，最高速度和最高伤害，但是攻击范围也是最小的，BOSS战时躲在下面几乎不能造成伤害，但是冲到BOSS前时很快就能将BOSS击破，火力提升加强斩击数量。
钝色（NIBIIRO）：贯穿集中型，火力强大而且具有贯穿能力，慢速模式将激光聚集提升伤害，类似爱丽丝，但是机体速度很慢，遇到到处跑的BOSS就有点尴尬，火力提升加强小激光数量。
亡魂不眠（FUMIN NAKITAMA）：散弹/设置型，慢速模式下会将小龙固定，高速模式收回，类似风神录的魔理沙八卦炉，因此在低速模式时可以不用考虑射击问题专心躲避，当然也会存在摆放不当导致更加吃力的情况。但是如果摆放得当，可以对那些站着不动的BOSS造成大量伤害，火力提升加强小龙威力。
デベ（Dev）：逆向弹幕型，弹幕会从屏幕上方射向魔导书，很有创意但是相当微妙的射击方式，优点是可以快速攻击屏幕上方的敌人，但是缺点是对于贴近自己的敌人有些无力（三面陨石之类的），火力提升加强弹幕威力。
天死（TENSHI）：攻击方式同天资，但是仅有一条命，残机量无法提升，也不能续命，作为补偿决死的时间比其他角色略长。
另外一提剧情真的很赞，值得花上几个小时去玩。
最后建议官方增加下音乐室的功能，音乐真的不错。
————————————————————————————————
官方还真出了音乐室功能，好评~
另外再提供一点有用的信息，屏幕左下角的三个数值，第一排是残机数，第二排是火力，第三排是BOOM，残机数靠绿色回复，小的一个提升0.05残机，大的一个提供0.1残机，每到1.00会自动增加1残机数（其实就是每MISS一次残机值会损失1.00，如果不够1.00就结束游戏），最大值尚未探明，但似乎存个六七个残机不是问题。火力值靠红色补充，同样是小的提供0.05，大的提供0.1，续命之后的黄色直接提升到最大值5.00，火力值每提升1.00攻击方式就会获得一次加强，封顶5.00，火力提升效果上面有说明这里不再重复。BOOM比较特殊，最大值为2.00，每次使用消耗1.00，如果BOOM值大于1.00可触发决死，决死放B不会有额外消耗。但是接下来问题来了，第一，BOOM值会继承，每次MISS不会回复BOOM值，只有续命才会回复到1.00。第二，BOOM值的获得方式不是通过蓝色或者紫色点，不要被骗了，每次击破小怪会提升0.01，击破BOSS的一条命会提升0.25（包括撑过时间），
二面的冰块和三面的陨石算障碍物不算小怪，因此击破不会提升BOOM值，请注意。

15811710.review:
I like to play bullet hell game. And since this was free, why not give it a try?

Overall I would recommend it since it is free and it is pretty interesting to see how different spellcards of Touhou got combined together (Seriously, I was laughing non-stop through the game. The bosses' attacks are.... fun in a sense.). It has almost the same mechanics as Touhou so if you know the basics you're good to go. 

I have only completed the first character upon this review (Tenshi, 1cc Normal first try) so it will be mostly based on this one experience.

The normal difficulty for first 2 stages are harder than most other bullet hell games. Mostly due to unexpected patterns when you think it is safe to go to auto-collection point. 

And the more I play, the more it become a 'Try-to-guess-the-original' game. I was thinking of "Ah, hi Satori, your lasers look good today. Oh? Suddenly Byakuren graced this occasion. How gracious. Mokou, please do not sudden leapt at me like that!"

That happened in just a spellcard for a boss.

The monsters pattern are also strikingly similar to QB shooting and exCeed (Touhou is already a given). Stage 3, it is almost the same as QB Shooting's 5th stage, barring rockets flying alongside you. 

The music is almost the same for all stages (at least that was the impression I had while playing). It feels like the music is there for the sake of it, and does not fit the characters / their danmaku style. Not a single sound track has a lasting impression on me.

And Tenshi is just Reimu in disguise.

====================================

Update after finishing Easy/Normal with all characters and losing Hard at last spell card :

There... isn't any story.Yes, you do know a little more about the characters, but there is no story to be seen. You could look at the bios for more backstory but... 

The difficulty range, to be honest, is pretty narrow. For the stage battles,  I do not feel much difference between easy and normal (except for more bullets) and between normal and hard (much more bullets but still easy enough to dodge). Spellcard battles on the other hand have nice difficulty increase. 

The playable characters (excluding the hidden characters) have attacks all exactly the same as Touhou's characters. Youmu's short range attack, Marisa's laser, Aya's spread attack, Reimu's homing, Yukari's hold position. Personally I prefer to use homing / laser. The laser girl has movement speed that is ridiculously slow (which is actually good in spellcard battle) and limited range of attack (straight above her), but her damage output is way beyond what others can dish out (other than perhaps the hidden hidden character, or the hidden character if you placed your position correctly)

Even after repeated playthroughs, the music still does not leave much of an impression on me, except perhaps some of the different last stage bosses. 

And I am not sure if I am glad that there is no lasers in this game, or am agonized that a straight chain of bullets are replacement for lasers. Either way, curving lasers are sin. (Wait, there are lasers.... and I hate Shou's (of Touhou) laser spellcards. Alien girl is my achillies heel.)

================================================================

15811244.review:
The least offensive review I can write is
"I wanted orange and I got lemon-lime."

Shitty steam reviews without scoring system, only a yes/no.
It's maybe a 5-6/10, but...

can't pause during death to restart, 
can't alt-f4, 
can't turn off the music without turning off speakers,
can't run at a constant 60 fps,
can't change resolution.

can uninstall.

Actual thoughts:
The game looks like it's very heavily inspired by the Touhou series, it's nice how the BGM titles are said when they start just like in Touhou, death-cancels through bo-- I mean auras, the bosses, but it just feels somewhat off. 
While most games of this genre have somewhat of a story, this jumps from scene to scene, doesn't feel coherent. The music feels slightly ill-fitting too. Were there audio control settings, I'd lower the volume to still hear the firing, but there isn't so I just keep the volume off.
Looks like a GameMaker game, which is not a problem of looks, I love Risk of Rain, but the poor optimization drops the game to sub-60fps with pretty little enemies and bullets on the screen, slowing it down. It helps you with the slow-mo, but it's not how it's supposed to be.

There is love, but it needs something else.

15810766.review:
＿人人人人人人人＿
＞　地獄季節感　＜
￣Y^Y^Y^Y^Y^Y￣

機械翻訳感満載のタイトルな本作だが、内容は日本的な弾幕STGで、中でも東方作品にかなり影響を受けたのが至る所で見受けられる。
見受けられるというかコピーと言ってもいいほどだがゲームとしてはしっかり作られている。
完全にインスパイアされたというレベルを超えてはいるけれども、フリーゲームだしファンメイド的なゲームとして。
そんなわけでまさに東方クローンといった本作は大元と変わらず弾幕が美しく、そして何よりもカジュアルで楽しい。
機械翻訳的で結構おかしいが会話の流れはある程度わかるレベルの日本語も入っているし、弾幕STGで個人的に大事な要素の音楽もかなりいいと思う。
キャラデザインが日本風でしっかりしているところも好印象。ぼくはゼータレティキュライ人の鈍色ちゃんが好きです(ロリ並感)


 [b] 東方だコレ。 [/b] と思った点としてまず目に付くのが弾幕の雰囲気(色・パターンなど)が完全に東方なところだ。
敵が妖精という点は別に東方だけに限ったわけではないけれども、東方に似てる事を考えるとなんかそれっぽい。 得点とパワーアップアイテムも色・形共にめちゃくちゃ東方っぽい。
道中で既に東方っぽさを存分に堪能していたわけだが、ボス戦で明らかにスペルカードを使用した時の演出が。
グレイズや喰らいボムもしっかり搭載しているし、主人公が何らかの異変を解決しに行くというお馴染みの設定も。
これはもう東方なのでは･･･？と思うほどの乗っかり具合である。

兎にも角にも、難易度も難しすぎずそこそこで、弾幕STGをプレイしたことのない人にとっても遊びやすい。
シューターにとっては物足りないかもしれないがゲームをする価値がないほどでは全然ない。
F2Pなのでとりあえず少し遊んでみてはいかがだろうか。

15810718.review: This is life..... This is kinda awesome.... Makes you RAGE sometimes.... but it's worth it :3 Play it ^^

15810684.review:
東方っぽいけど東方じゃない、東方リスペクトな無料STG。
なんと使える自機は5+α。弾速の遅い簡単モードからやってみよう。
本家シリーズを遊んでいる人にならわかる、見覚えのある弾幕もちらほらと・・・？






ここから各自機の性能及び難所ステージの羅列。
ネタバレ込かつ非常に長くなるので、暇があれば読んでもらえるとうれしい。
---------------------------------------------------------------------
【天賽】
攻撃方法:自機ショット+ホーミング(威力:弱～中)
移動速度:高(低速時:中)

道中の敵の対処を最もしやすい。対してボスの撃破は少し時間がかかる。
難所は第4ステージ(ボス:不眠)と第5ステージ。
状況によっては第3ステージの回転弾幕も難所になりうる。
クリア実績を最も取りやすい機体。

【ボスとして】
※隠しキャラのデベを選んだ時は出現しない。
※天死を選んだ時は最終ステージに出現する。
--------------------------------------------------------
【水色】
攻撃方法:自機ショット+前方中範囲直線攻撃(威力:中)
移動速度:中(低速度:低)

天賽よりもボスを撃破しやすいが、道中のパターンの把握が必要。
左右に動く敵には強くない。
難所は第4ステージ(ボス:不眠)と第5ステージ。
状況によっては第3ステージの回転弾幕も難所になりうる。

---------------------------------------------------------------------

【栄枯】
攻撃方法:攻撃射程が短い自機ショット(威力:大)
移動速度:中(低速度:中)

栄枯で高難易度を極めるのはかなり難しいと思う。
アイテムの取り逃がしを発生させにくいのが利点か。
攻撃の射程が短いため、全ステージを油断せずに進むべし。

---------------------------------------------------------------------

【鈍色】
攻撃方法:自機レーザー(威力:大)
移動速度:低(低速度:低)

フルパワーを維持できれば、ボスを最も早く撃破しやすい機体。
自機スピードがかなり遅いので、アイテムの回収を無理にすると事故りやすい。
早い攻撃を仕掛けてくるボス天賽とボス不眠、最終ステージボスが特に厄介。

---------------------------------------------------------------------

【不眠】
攻撃方法:セミホーミング置きドラゴン(威力:中)
移動速度:高(低速時:中)

ショット当てと分担しなくて済むため、避けに専念できる機体。弾幕を覚えるのにも便利。
画面の真ん中下にドラゴンを配置した時が一番効率良いように感じた。
パワーを下げられると苦しくなりやすいので、慎重に動こう。
---------------------------------------------------------------------


【デベ】
↑の全キャラでクリアすると選択可能になる。
【天死】
オワタ式天賽。デベを含めた全キャラでクリアすると選択可能になる。
このキャラで難易度：地獄をクリアする実績が存在する。

15809220.review: I had to switch to using a controller with the cross pad to play this without dying, I was playing on easy and it seemed like impossible mode but even though it seemed so difficult I could'nt stop playing because it was fun and challenging.  This reminds me of the old top down bullet hell shooters from long ago only more difficult and with anime.  I could not pass up trying it because I used to love those types of games back in the eighties on the 8-bit nes and like everyone else says you can't go wrong with free.  I don't remember those old shooters being this hard though and with this many bullets all over the screen.  Either that or I just had better reflexes as a kid.  I made it to the 3rd boss and took a break, I will play some more later though when in the mood because it is fun.  On another note I noticed alot of people talking about the music, honestly I did not really notice the music that much because I was so focused on dodging all the bullets, but as I recall the music in the background seemed pleasant and fine, I really did not even notice it was chiptune style so I say the music was good.  The anime art was fine, maybe not the most awesome anime art i've ever seen but still good.  Over all it is free and fun and worth a try.  7.5/10

15806321.review:
Very good Danmaku (Bulet Hell) game. Even though it's only the genre that's similar, apart from the Japanese theme, this game reminds me a lot of the Touhou franchise. 

Anyway, Jigoku Kisetsukan: Sense of the Seasons, thrusts you into an immersive, rage inducing, addicting experience that will leave you craving more. The game has a difficulty adjuster (thank goodness) so you can get immersed even if you are a newcomer to the genre. 

The gameplay is very simple: Move around the screen killing enemies and collecting point cards without getting hit. If you get hit once, you die. you get three lives and three continues. 

The bosses are actually characters that, once you defeat them in combat, become unlocked and playable. Each one has their own unique attacks that change as their power level goes up. some characters are slower than others, some are faster than others, so there is a bit of an option there if you like faster or slower moving characters.

Overall, not a bad game. I rate it a 8/10

15802859.review:
I recommend this game for every Shmup fan on steam because it's free.

BUT : 

This is a Danmaku made by a guy (Italian I think), and we can clearly see that he's a fan of Touhou. Everything looks like Touhou, the enemy Health bar, the first character, and the spellcards are pretty similar. That's not a bad point.

BUT (So many Buts, pun intended), it fails at creating a real atmosphere. You just have a background (like fog, space etc), and you're shooting enemies familiar to the elements (example : Aliens or Robots in space). Of course, the main goal on a game like this is to score a maximum of points, but it looks generic.

Gameplay is pretty much the same as Touhou or eXceed, you can graze (you have to if you wanna score anyway), you can bullet cancel with bomb, you also can cancel your death with bombs. You have a focus button to slow down and make your hitpoint visible.

The problem with the game, is the optimization. Sometimes it's full of colorful effects and the game runs at 60 fps. Sometimes, just because of the moving background, the game runs at 45/50 fps, creating a feeling of playing into the Matrix. Looks really weird.

Music-wise, it's good, not great. It's good because I heard some Dubmood in it, but like I said, it fails at delivering an atmosphere. Think of Touhou (very traditional music) or eXceed (more action = more agressive music). Jigoku offers good music, but that kinda feels off for this type of game. Musics don't fit that well to stages/bosses.


FINAL : It's free, so why not give it a try ? I still recommend it, but if you wanna play something more serious, go for Touhou, eXceed, Ikaruga or even Alltynex Second.

But it's free, so why are you even reading this? Just play it for yourself. No F2P shenanigans from what I could see. 39609933.review:
If you have always wanted to get into Tohou or the SHMUP genre but haven't been sure if you would enjoy it and don't want to spend money, this is the game for you. Well, this or XOP Ultra, but XOP Ultra is a lot less forgiving, and instead of making pretty bullet patterns it just tries to rip your face off.

There's a story to Jigoku Kietsukan, but it's very bare bones. It differs depending on the character you are playing as, but the gameplay is always the same. Go through level, dodge bullets, fight boss, beat boss, move on. You just move around and shoot things, trying not to die as hundreds of bullets fly through the air at you. It's very standard SHMUP gameplay, exactly as you would expect. The one quirk is that when you are hit, there is a couple second window with a timer above your head where you can cancel your death using a bomb. Maybe I missed part of the instructions, but that would have been good to know before I was a few hours in.


Jigoku Kietsukan has problems. The anime aesthetic can be a little off-putting sometimes. Other reviewers have mentioned issues with hitboxes and controls, and although I didn't notice the hitboxes, the controls are pretty odd. The difficulty curve is fairly consistent, until it ramps up ridiculously during the final level, leaving you wondering what just happened and where those patterns were for the rest of the game.


That being said, it's a free bullet hell game, and judging by the art a lot of time obviously put into making it. The music is original and really good, and the graphics are decent. Overall, if you're looking to get into the bullet hell genre, definitely try this out. It should give you an idea of whether you will enjoy yourself. XOP is another one to try, although definitely is less like Tohou and more like Donpachi.

39929196.review:
Jigoku Kisetsukan: Sense of the Seasons is an incredibly well made gateway into the genre of crazy danmaku bullet hell games. It requires a lot of practice for newcomers to reach the first boss on the lowest difficulty settings, let alone beat a story or the entire game altogether. Dedication is a prerequisite to actually learn how to play and not be completely overwhelmed by its notorious difficulty.

The overall graphics and sounds including the music are polished and put together with a good eye for detail and quality. Even though the character artwork does emit a vibe of high school amateur manga drawings, they are cleaned up nicely and are evidently made with great care. The pixel art is precise and its colourful presentation is a visual help, which is nothing less than essential for the gameplay of these type of games. The music tracks, stretching over chiptune to ambient and rock, adapt to the scenes and attack patterns of the enemies. Although the tracks are always the same for each area and boss, they are still great to listen to and don't get stale too fast even after hours of rather repetitive gameplay.

There are seven different characters to unlock, six of them with their own movement speed, weapons and damage values. Starting out with one character in the beginning, each completed stage ends with a boss fight against one of the other playable characters which become available after defeating them. They all have their own personalities and each a fundamental issue they carry about with themselves. Completing their story ends in facing these issues impersonated by a final endboss. The overall story is short and not too cheesy. There's thought behind it and it's more than just a padding for an arcady game but story is also clearly not its focus.

The gameplay is superb. Every boss introduces a new kind of pattern that shakes up the gameplay and pushes the player out of the comfort zone of minimal movement. With tight and precise controls, overwhelming enemy attack patterns and a very confined space to navigate, the game offers the trance-like experience of staying focused under pressure. It's full immersion through gameplay.

Jigoku Kisetsukan: Sense of the Seasons offers a genuine [i]sense of pride and accomplishment[/i] after beating it on any difficulty. It's a wholly recommendable title for anyone interested in danmaku games, newcomer or veteran alike.

Oldukça güzel mini bullet hell tarzı bir oyun. Özellikle bu bu tarz oyunları sevenler için bulunmaz bir nimet, üstelik ücretsiz. Karakterlerin kendilerine ait bir oynanış tarzı var. 

OYUNUN ARTILARI
-Çizimler güzel
-Grafikler göz yormuyor(pixel olmasına rağmen)
-Ücretsiz
-Oldukça hoş bir müziği var
-TOUHOU!

OYUNUN EKSİLERİ
-Bosslar aşırı zor easy mode bile size cehennem gibi gelebilir
